intro: Halanthium kulpianum var. roseum, commonly known as the pink marshmallow, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its soft, fleshy stems and leaves that are typically covered in a white, powdery coating. Its flowers are pink or purple, arranged in dense, spherical clusters, and bloom in late spring to early summer. This variant is distinguished by its more vivid pink floral coloration compared to the typical form of the species.
